attributes.action: Free child care to be subject to net income of parents. Not just one parent.
attributes.additional_details:
Family A
- Parent 1 earns £99k
- Parent 2 earns £99k
- Total = £198k
- Household allowed 30 hours free child care

Family B
- Parent 1 earns £101k
- Parent 2 earns £15k
- Total = £116k
- Household is not entitled to free childcare (despite net income £82k less!)

One parent exceeding £100k can cause a reduction of actual net income as it is subject to reduced tax free allowance & having to pay for childcare. (e.g. Small pay rise from £95k past £100k can make you worse off)
attributes.background:
Government will provide 30 hours a week free childcare. One of the conditions is if 'you' earn less than £100k.

This enables two parents who both earn less than £100k to far exceed the net income of another family where only one individual earns more than £100k. 

Unreasonable balance.
